thing-type.label: MH-P220 MINI ENERGY DIMMER
thing-type.description: MINI ENERGY DIMMER<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtMINI ENERGY DIMMER</p&gt <p&gtConserve energy, save money and enjoy pleasent lightning ambient in your automated home.</p&gt <p&gtDESCRIPTION</p&gt <p&gtZipato Mini Energy Dimmer provides variable indoor lightning, creating pleasant ambience in your home while helping you reduce overall energy consumption. This Z-Wave enabled module can be set in most existing in-wall switches where it can be used to control connected appliances, with Zipato home automation controllers, Z-Wave remotes or module’s built-in push button. </p&gt <p&gtPRODUCT FEATURES</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtSlim, compact Z-Wave incandescent dimmer provides variable indoor lightning, switches your lightning equipment and reports their energy consumption. </li&gt <li&gtDesigned to dim most fluorescent, tungsten, halogen, sodium and leading edge lights</li&gt <li&gtFits into most existing in-wall switches</li&gt <li&gtResistive load 1x500W @ 220VAC, 1x300W at 120VAC</li&gt <li&gtZero-crossing switch</li&gt <li&gtReports immediate voltage, current and energy consumption. </li&gt <li&gtCan act as a repeater in any Z-Wave network</li&gt <li&gtVery low power consumption</li&gt <li&gtEasy installation</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtINCLUDING THE MINI ENERGY DIMMER INTO YOUR NETWORK</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet the controller into INCLUSION mode. Follow the instructions provided by the controller manufacturer.</li&gt <li&gtPress the momentary button on the Mini Energy Dimmer, or connected external button S1 3 times in quick succession</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote: If the inclusion is successful, the INDICATION LED will be solid on or off depending on switch’s state. If not, INDICATION LED will blink slowly.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtEXCLUDING THE MINI ENERGY DIMMER INTO YOUR NETWORK</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet the controller into EXCLUSION mode. Follow the instructions provided by the controller manufacturer.</li&gt <li&gtPress the momentary button on the Mini Energy Dimmer, or the connected S1 button 3 times in quick succession.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote: If the exclusion is successful, the INDICATION LED will blink slowly. If not, INDICATION LED will be solid on or off depending on switch’s state.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_0_1
parameter.label: 0: Switch All Mode
parameter.description: Set the mode for the switch when receiving SWITCH ALL commands.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet the mode for the switch when receiving SWITCH ALL commands.</p&gt <p&gtThe following option values may be configured -: | Value | Description | |--------|-------------| | 0 | Exclude from All On and All Off groups | | 1 | Include in All On group | | 2 | Include in All Off group | | 255 | Include in All On and All Off groups |</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID switchall_mode and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Exclude from All On and All Off groups
Include in All On and All Off groups

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Dimmer state after power down
parameter.description: Dimmer state saved or not when power is down<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0x00 not saved, Dimmer will be off when powered again 0x01 saved, Dimmer will keep the same state when powered again</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: External type switch
parameter.description: Momentary buttons/2-state Switches/S1 dim up, S2 dim down<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtExternal switch type</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 2 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_2_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: S1 dim up, S2 dim down

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: 2-state switches
parameter.description: toggle Dimmer without or with specified on/off position<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt2-state Switches</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 1 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_3_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameter.description: forbid/allow ALL ON/ALL OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtALL ON/ALL OFF</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 255.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_4_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: forbid ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF
forbid ALL ON, allow ALL OFF
allow ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF
allow ALL ON, allow ALL OFF

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Minimum brightness level
parameter.description: percentage brightness level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtMinimum brightness level</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 1 to 98 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_5_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Maximum brightness level
parameter.description: 2~99 percentage brightness level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtMaximum brightness level</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 2 to 99 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 99.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_6_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_2
parameter.label: 7: Single dimming step time(Manual)
parameter.description: Max 2.55s, in 10ms steps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSingle dimming step time(Manual)</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 1 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 3.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_7_2 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Single dimming step size (Manual)
parameter.description: 1~99 percentage value (modification isn’t recommended)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSingle dimming step size (Manual)</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 1 to 99 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_8_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_2
parameter.label: 9: Single dimming step time (Auto)
parameter.description: Max 2.55s, in 10ms steps<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSingle dimming step time (Auto)</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 1 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 3.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_9_2 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Single dimming step size (Auto)
parameter.description: 1~99 percentage value (modification isn’t recommended)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSingle dimming step size (Auto)</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 1 to 99 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_10_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Timer function (Auto-off)
parameter.description: 0x00 function disabled 0x0001~0x00FF 1s~255s<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTimer function (Auto-off)</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_11_2 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_0
parameter.label: 12: Reversed
parameter.description: Reversed

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: One click of S1
parameter.description: 1~99 percentage value switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtOne click of S1</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 99 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 99.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_13_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Double click of S1
parameter.description: max brightness level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDouble click of S1</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 1 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_14_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Operation report Switch1 to Assoc Group 2 & 3
parameter.description: Dimming level report only valid when holding external button<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtOperation report from Switch1 to Association Group 2 &amp; 3</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_15_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Operation report Switch1 to Association Group 2
parameter.description: Operation report from Switch1 to Association Group 2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtOperation report from Switch1 to Association Group 2</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 1 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_16_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Switch 2 function
parameter.description: Enable S2 switch, enable Scene Activation and send Basic Set<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSwitch 2 function</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 1.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_17_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: enable Scene Activation, and send Basic Set ON/OFF

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: Operation report Switch2 to Association Group 4
parameter.description: Operation report from Switch2 to Association Group 4<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtOperation report from Switch2 to Association Group 4</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_18_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: send Basic ON or Basic OFF

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Scene ID sent to AG1 when one click of S2
parameter.description: 0 Scene Activation disabled 1~255 send Activation CC to AG1<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtScene ID sent to AG1 when one click of S2</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_19_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Scene ID sent to AG1 when double click of S2
parameter.description: 0 Scene Activation disabled 1~255 send Activation CC<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtScene ID sent to AG1 when double click of S2</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_20_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Scene ID sent to AG1 when hold S2
parameter.description: 0 Scene Activation disabled 1~255 send Activation CC<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtScene ID sent to AG1 when hold S2</p&gt <p&gtValues in the range 0 to 255 may be set.</p&gt <p&gtThe manufacturer defined default value is 0.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter has the configuration ID config_21_1 and is of type INTEGER.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_255_1_wo
parameter.label: 255: Factory setting
parameter.description: 0x55 restore factory setting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0x55 restore factory<br /&gtsetting, write only</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Reports device’s dimming state
parameter.description: reports device’s dimming state. It supports only one Node ID. A controller / gateway SHOULD be associated to this AG.

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: S1 Basic Set Command
parameter.description: to control the associated devices synchonously. When S1’s state changes, it will send “Basic Set Command” to these devices.

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: S1 Multi-level Set Command
parameter.description: to control the associated devices synchronously. When S1’s state changes, it will send “Multi-level Set Command” to these devices.

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: S2 Basic Set Command
parameter.description: to control the associated devices synchronously. When S2’s state changes, it will send “Basic Set Command” to these devices.
